info.title: Mini Chat API
info.description: Multi-tenant AI chat module. Provides conversational AI with streaming responses, document and image upload, file search, per-user quota enforcement, and audit event emission. All endpoints require authentication and tenant license verification (ai_chat feature).

post.description: Creates a chat for the authenticated user. The optional `model` field selects a model from the deployment model catalog; if omitted, the catalog default (first entry) is used. The model is locked for the chat lifetime.

get.summary: List chats for the current user
get.description: Returns chats for the authenticated user ordered by most recent activity (updated_at DESC). Supports cursor-based pagination and OData `$select` field projection. This endpoint supports OData `$select` for sparse field projection. Field names are case-insensitive. Dot notation is supported for nested objects.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Opaque cursor for fetching the next page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData field projection parameter. Comma-separated list of fields. Supports dot notation for nested fields. Case-insensitive.

get.description: Returns chat metadata (including selected model) and the most recent messages.

delete.description: Soft-deletes the chat and marks attachments for asynchronous cleanup. External provider resources (files, chat vector stores) are removed by a background cleanup worker with idempotent retries.

204.description: Chat deleted. Cleanup of external resources is asynchronous.

post.summary: Send message and receive streamed AI response
post.description:
Sends a user message and opens an SSE stream for the assistant response. If `request_id` matches an active generation, returns 409 Conflict (JSON, no SSE). If `request_id` matches a completed generation, replays the response as SSE.

The optional `web_search` parameter enables web search for this turn (disabled by default, backward compatible).

**SSE event ordering**: `ping* (delta | tool | citations)* (done | error)`

Exactly one terminal event (`done` or `error`) ends the stream.

**SSE event types and payloads**:
- `event: ping` — keepalive, payload: `{}`. Clients MUST ignore.
- `event: delta` — incremental text. Payload: `SseDeltaEvent`.
- `event: tool` — tool activity (file_search, web_search at P1). Payload: `SseToolEvent`.
- `event: citations` — source references (file and web). Payload: `SseCitationsEvent`.
- `event: done` — terminal success with usage and quota_decision. Payload: `SseDoneEvent`.
- `event: error` — terminal failure. Payload: `SseErrorEvent`.

See component schemas for payload definitions.

**Pre-stream errors**: If validation, authorization, or quota preflight fails before streaming, a JSON error response with the appropriate HTTP status is returned and no SSE stream is opened.

**Cancellation**: If the client disconnects mid-stream, the server cancels the in-flight provider request and applies a bounded best-effort debit for quota.

example.content: What does the document say about Q3 revenue?

200.description: SSE stream opened. Events delivered as `text/event-stream`. See operation description for event types and payload schemas.

schema.description: Server-Sent Events stream. Each event has `event:` type and `data:` JSON payload. See SseDeltaEvent, SseToolEvent, SseCitationsEvent, SseDoneEvent, SseErrorEvent schemas.

400.description: Bad request. Possible codes: `too_many_images` (exceeds per-message image input limit), `web_search_disabled` (web search requested but kill switch is active).

409.description: A generation is already running for this `(chat_id, request_id)`.

413.description: Image bytes exceeded per-turn limit. Code: `image_bytes_exceeded`.

415.description: Effective model does not support multimodal input. Validation occurs after downgrade decision and before provider call. Code: `unsupported_media`.

429.description: Token quota exceeded. Code: `quota_exceeded`, `quota_scope`: `tokens`. Returned when all tier quotas are exhausted, emergency flags force rejection, or all models are disabled.

502.description: LLM provider error. Code: `provider_error`. Returned as JSON response if failure occurs before SSE stream is opened. If failure occurs after streaming begins, delivered as terminal SSE `event: error` while HTTP status remains 200.

504.description: LLM provider timeout. Code: `provider_timeout`. Returned as JSON response if failure occurs before SSE stream is opened. If failure occurs after streaming begins, delivered as terminal SSE `event: error` while HTTP status remains 200.

post.summary: Upload a document or image to a chat
post.description: Uploads a file as an attachment. MIME type determines `kind`: `image/png`, `image/jpeg`, `image/webp` produce `image` attachments; all other supported types produce `document` attachments. Documents are indexed in the chat's dedicated vector store and optionally summarized. Images are stored via the provider Files API but NOT indexed in vector stores. Returns immediately with `status: pending`; transitions to `ready` or `failed` asynchronously.

201.description: Attachment created. Processing is asynchronous; poll chat detail or listen for status transitions.

413.description: File exceeds the configured upload size limit. Code: `file_too_large`.

get.description: Returns the server-side turn state for a given request_id. Used by the UI for disconnect recovery. Internal states map to API states: running->running, completed->done, failed->error, cancelled->cancelled.

patch.summary: Edit the last user turn and regenerate response
patch.description: Replaces the content of the last user message and generates a new assistant response via SSE. The previous turn is soft-deleted with `replaced_by_request_id` set. Original `attachment_ids` are preserved. Only the most recent non-deleted turn in a terminal state may be edited.

200.description: SSE stream with new assistant response. Same event contract as sendMessage.

schema.description: Server-Sent Events stream. See sendMessage operation for event types.

400.description: Turn not in terminal state. Code: `invalid_turn_state`.

409.description: Target is not the most recent turn. Code: `not_latest_turn`.

429.description: Token quota exceeded for regeneration. Code: `quota_exceeded`, `quota_scope`: `tokens`.

delete.description: Soft-deletes the most recent turn (user message + assistant response). Only the latest non-deleted turn in a terminal state may be deleted. No replacement turn is created.

400.description: Turn not in terminal state. Code: `invalid_turn_state`.

409.description: Target is not the most recent turn. Code: `not_latest_turn`.

post.description: Soft-deletes the previous turn and re-submits the original user message (including any attachment_ids) for a new assistant response via SSE. Only the most recent non-deleted turn in a terminal state may be retried.

200.description: SSE stream with new assistant response. Same event contract as sendMessage.

schema.description: Server-Sent Events stream. See sendMessage operation for event types.

400.description: Turn not in terminal state. Code: `invalid_turn_state`.

409.description: Target is not the most recent turn. Code: `not_latest_turn`.

429.description: Token quota exceeded for regeneration. Code: `quota_exceeded`, `quota_scope`: `tokens`.

put.summary: Set like/dislike on an assistant message
put.description: Upserts a binary reaction on an assistant message. Only assistant messages may receive reactions. Idempotent: replaces any existing reaction for this user on this message.

400.description: Target is not an assistant message. Code: `invalid_reaction_target`.

404.description: Chat or message not found. Code: `chat_not_found` or `message_not_found`.

delete.summary: Remove reaction from an assistant message
delete.description: Removes the current user's reaction from an assistant message. Idempotent: returns 200 even if no reaction exists.

bearerAuth.description: Platform AuthN JWT or opaque token. Extracts user_id and tenant_id into the request security context.

RequestId.name: request_id
RequestId.description: Client-generated idempotency key UUID identifying a turn.

Forbidden.description: Tenant lacks `ai_chat` license (code: `feature_not_licensed`) or subject lacks permission (code: `insufficient_permissions`).

NotFound.description: Resource not found or not accessible under current authorization constraints. Code: `chat_not_found` or `message_not_found`. AuthZ fail-closed: denied requests with a concrete resource ID return 404.

ErrorResponse.description: Standard error envelope for JSON error responses and SSE terminal error events.

GenericError.description: Error response for all non-quota error codes.

QuotaExceededError.description: Error response for quota exhaustion. The quota_scope field is REQUIRED and distinguishes token quota exhaustion from upload quota exhaustion.

quota_scope.description: Distinguishes token quota exhaustion (tokens) from upload quota exhaustion (uploads). Clients MUST use this field, not message parsing, to determine quota scope.

Chat.description: Chat metadata. Returned by create, list, and as part of chat detail.

model.description: Model identifier from the deployment model catalog. Locked at creation for the chat lifetime.

is_temporary.description: P2 feature. Schema column reserved; always false at P1.

ChatDetail.description: Chat metadata with recent messages. Returned by getChat.

messages.description: Most recent messages in chronological order, deterministically ordered by (created_at, id). The server enforces an internal configurable limit. This endpoint does not support pagination at P1.

Message.description: A single message in a chat (user, assistant, or system).

request_id.description: Client-generated idempotency key. Null for system messages.

model.description: Effective model used. Present on assistant messages; null on user/system messages.

input_tokens.description: Actual input tokens. Present on assistant messages.

output_tokens.description: Actual output tokens. Present on assistant messages.

Attachment.description: File attachment (document or image) on a chat.

status.description: Processing status. Transitions: pending -> ready or pending -> failed.

kind.description: Derived from MIME type. image/png, image/jpeg, image/webp -> image; all other supported types -> document.

content_type.description: MIME type of the uploaded file.

doc_summary.description: LLM-generated document summary. Present for documents after background processing completes; always null for images.

TurnStatus.description: Authoritative server-side turn state. Internal-to-API state mapping: running->running, completed->done, failed->error, cancelled->cancelled. All terminal states (done, error, cancelled) indicate that quota settlement has been finalized.

CreateChatRequest.description: Request body for creating a new chat.

model.description: Model from the deployment model catalog. If omitted, the catalog default (first entry) is used.

SendMessageRequest.description: Request body for sending a message. Opens an SSE stream on success.

request_id.description: Client-generated idempotency key. If a running turn exists for this (chat_id, request_id), the server returns 409. If a completed turn exists, the server replays the response.

attachment_ids.description: Attachment IDs (images or documents) to include in this turn. Attachments must belong to this chat, must have status=ready, and are validated after effective model capability resolution.

EditTurnRequest.description: Request body for editing the last user turn. Original attachment_ids are preserved automatically.

SseDeltaEvent.description: SSE `event: delta` payload. Streams incremental assistant text output.

type.description: Content type. P1: always "text". Reserved for future: "markdown", "structured".

SseToolEvent.description: SSE `event: tool` payload. Reports tool call activity (P1: file_search, web_search).

files_searched.description: Number of files searched. Present in phase=done.

SseCitationsEvent.description: SSE `event: citations` payload. Delivers source references used in the answer. Emitted once near stream completion before the terminal event.

source.description: Citation source type. P1: "file" and "web" (when web search is enabled).

url.description: URL for web sources. Present when source="web".

attachment_id.description: Internal attachment ID. The only file identifier exposed to clients.

span.description: Reserved for mapping citations to character positions in final assistant text.

SseDoneEvent.description: SSE `event: done` payload. Terminal event finalizing the stream with usage and model selection metadata.

effective_model.description: Model actually used for this turn after quota and policy evaluation. Always present.

selected_model.description: Model chosen at chat creation (chats.model). Always present. Equals effective_model when no downgrade occurred.

quota_decision.description: Indicates whether the selected model was used as-is (allow) or a quota-driven downgrade occurred (downgrade). Always present.

downgrade_from.description: Always equals selected_model when present. The model from which the quota-driven downgrade occurred. Present only when quota_decision="downgrade".

downgrade_reason.description: Why downgrade occurred. Present only when quota_decision="downgrade".

SseUsage.description: Token usage reported in the terminal done event.

input_tokens.description: Actual input tokens (includes image token costs if applicable).

model.description: Effective model used for generation. May differ from the chat's locked model if a quota-driven downgrade occurred; see quota_decision on the done event.

SseErrorEvent.description: SSE `event: error` payload. Terminal event indicating a failure after the stream has started. Shares the same error envelope as JSON error responses: GenericError for all non-quota errors, QuotaExceededError (with required quota_scope) when code is quota_exceeded.

WebSearchOption.description: Controls web search for this turn. Defaults to disabled when omitted (backward compatible).

enabled.description: When true, the web_search tool is included in the provider request. The provider decides whether to invoke the tool. If the global disable_web_search kill switch is active, the request is rejected with web_search_disabled (400).

QuotaDecision.description: Deprecated as standalone schema — fields are now inlined on SseDoneEvent. Retained for backward reference only.
